div.h2: Class of 2020, School Closure, Daycare Info and Me...

div.div:
Class of 2020, School Closure, Daycare Info and Meal Distribution
Per Governor Evers order, schools are closed through rest of 2019/2020 school year. See plans moving forward for our 2020 Graduates in the "News" section. Lunch and Breakfast are available, free of charge, please see the "News" section of the website for more information about these deliveries. The daycare will remain open during the school closure. The Pandemic Plan and new policies and procedures are listed in the "News" section of the website and in effect as of 3/19/20.

span.a: You are currently on this page - Happenings

div.p: We have been discussing how we will honor our 2020 Graduates during this school closure. The Town Board approved allowing the District to place graduate banners on the town lamp posts. The town crew will put them up for us.

p.b: We are planning to do the following to honor our graduates*:

div.p: 1) Parents and Graduates are voting on Family ID between 4 graduation options
2) Honor each graduate on Facebook w/picture & quotes
3) Graduate pictures on banners downtown Phelps lamp posts
4) Phelps Women's Club sign by the museum is scrolling names & congratulations
5) News Review will feature graduates
*Options for graduation are subject to change depending on Governor's orders/virus conditions at the time. The Board will consider the graduation option chosen by families and set the date.

Under these difficult times we are trying to do more to honor our graduates, hoping it will ease their disappointment in missing out on so many of the normal celebrations which occur throughout their senior year!

p.span: Phelps Staff Step-up in a Big Way to Educate All Children!

span.span: All staff have stepped up in a big way to help all of our students to make progress in their academic learning.
Here are just some of the many strategies being used:
Google Classroom – safe online environment for communication and learning
Google Hangouts/Meets for virtual face-to-face communication
Google Screen Share for teachers to explain schoolwork 1:1
Additional Google tools
Innovative and flexible lessons and instruction
Videos
Paper assignments
Verbal interaction to complete assignments
Online tours and instruction
eLearning digital lessons
Teachers send daily summaries to administrator to share positives and concerns to allow for changes and addressing those concerns involving instruction
Flexible due dates for schoolwork
Helping improve student internet as possible
Completing and turning in schoolwork
Mail – receiving and returning paper assignments
Thursday Homework Exchange from 10am-1pm at school in commons
Submitting pictures of work
Scan and submit work
Complete work in Google Classroom
Monitoring gradebooks
Teachers correct and enter grades into Infinite Campus (IC)
Parents & Students can monitor assignments in IC
Parents & Students can check grades in IC
Teachers contact students and parents regarding poor quality/missing assignments
Mr. Pertile monitors student assignment completion and contact students and parents
Progress Reports and Report Cards will continue as normal
PBIS, Character Ed, SEL and counseling services
Mr. Grafwallner continues to provide PBIS/SEL lessons for teachers to share with students
Mrs. Duquaine provides Character Ed/SEL lessons for teachers to share with students and she also provides students with these lessons
Mr. Pertile, Mrs. Duquaine and Mrs. Phalin continue to reach out to students to provide counseling services to help students to cope with these difficult times

It is very apparent everyone involved in RVL is collaborating with colleagues, students and parents to ensure every child will learn during this difficult time. Please know we want to help you. We are here to support you and your child navigate through RVL. Thank you for your support for our staff as we also go through challenges of a new system.
Sincerely
Dr. Delnice Hill

span.span: EFFECTIVE MARCH 19,2020
Pandemic plan

In the event of school closures, the daycare and school officials will work closely with the State licensor, and other government officials, to make sure we can operate within the protocol of the school order. If allowed to remain open, the following policies will go into immediate effect:
*Travelling out of the state of Wisconsin-Families must notify daycare upon returning from a visit out of state. Daycare will make a decision to re-enter on a case by case basis.

*All children who won’t be in attendance for the day need to contact the daycare before 8 am. You need to let the center know the reason-travel, sick, etc. The daycare will review on a case by case basis.

*If your child or any family member develop any signs of the COVID-19, you will be asked to not be in attendance for 14 days. If a case is reported, the daycare will report to the health department, and may close in order to reduce the spread of any further cases.
*As long as the state allows the center to stay open, we will accommodate all families that we can.

*The center will accept all Phelps residence and children within our Phelps District, first. The remainder of spots filled will be based off of already enrolled children, full time, then part time children.
*New enrollments will not be accepted at this time.

*Phelps daycare will conduct a health check in the morning. If your child is displaying any signs of illness, you will be asked to take your child home, with not returning until child is symptom free for 24 hours.

*Our kitchen staff will not be available during this time. Parents are required to bring breakfast and lunch for children. Please make sure you are packing your child nutritious meals. Phelps Daycare will provide snack and milk.
*Parents must come and go through the front doors. If key card does not work, you must use the daycare back door since doors can’t be opened remotely.

*Above all, our main priority is to keep the children safe! It at any time we feel this is compromised, we will contact all families and shut down immediately. Any questions or concerns, please contact the daycare directly.

p.span: Phelps School will deliver meals on Monday and Thursday. A cooler will need to be placed at the end of your driveway and meals will be delivered between the approximate times of 10 and noon. If you do not have a cooler at the end of your driveway no meals will be left for your household. Please sign up on Family ID for this service weekly, and before Sunday.

div.p: Three Lakes And Phelps School Districts Announce Academic Co-op

Three Lakes and Phelps, Wisconsin — The school districts of Three Lakes and Phelps are excited to announce a first-of-its-kind partnership in the state of Wisconsin. After years of partnering in athletics, the two districts will begin an academic co-op during the second semester of 2019-20 as a way to increase student options by sharing staff and curriculum.

The academic co-op is a blended learning option for students. Blended learning, as defined by the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction, is a formal education program where students learn at least in part through online delivery of content and instruction while at a supervised brick-and-mortar location. Current examples of blended learning include courses through Wisconsin Virtual School or Start College Now with Nicolet College.

The new co-op between Phelps and Three Lakes is the first time blended learning will be used between two rural Wisconsin districts. Through this option, an instructor from one district can lead a classroom with students from both districts. Students will be able to connect and learn partly through online platforms and partly through face-to-face classroom time. For 2019-20, the program will begin with a pilot class in chemistry taught by Three Lakes instructor Al Votis.

“We are not talking ‘consolidation,’ but ‘true partnership,’” said Phelps District Administrator Dr. Delnice Hill. “As we continue to evolve and take full advantage of the opportunities we have in rural Northern Wisconsin, our students will be the benefactors.”
Three Lakes District Administrator Teri Maney emphasizes that this new academic co-op will continue the Three Lakes tradition of personalized education.

“Three Lakes and Phelps have successfully partnered together through our athletic co-ops, but moving into the academic arena is especially exciting for our districts,” Maney said. “Perhaps working together in a blended learning environment with our neighbors will be the best experience yet.”

Dr. Hill and Phelps Dean of Students Jason Pertile have worked with Maney and Three Lakes High School Principal Gene Welhoefer since the beginning of the 2019-20 school year to make this program a reality. The Three Lakes Board of Education approved the program at its December 2019 meeting.

About TLSD - Three Lakes School District is located in Oneida County, Wisconsin, in the heart of the North- woods. Our district includes Sugar Camp Elementary, Three Lakes Elementary and Three Lakes Jr./Sr. High schools and the communities of Hiles, Monico, Piehl, Stella, Sugar Camp and Three Lakes. Our award-winning district has received a 2017 Magna Award Honorable Mention and has been recognized as a Title 1 School of Recognition.

About Phelps School District - Nestled in the Nicolet National Forest, Phelps School District serves students in grades 4K-12th grade. Phelps has been awarded the US News and World Report Bronze Award for top high schools in the nation and has been designated as a Wisconsin School of Recognition seven times between 2003 and 2011.
4451 Old School Road // Phelps, WI 54554
